items.title: TVS Motor Acquires Ion Mobility, Strengthening Electric Mobility in ASEAN
items.author: James Chan
items.summary:
- TVS Motor has acquired Singapore-based e-scooter startup Ion Mobility.  
- The acquisition was announced by Ion Mobility's founder and CEO, James Chan, and includes all assets and intellectual property.  
- Chan will join TVS as senior vice president overseeing the ASEAN market starting April 1, 2025.  
- TVS plans to relaunch Ion's flagship electric scooter, the M1-S, with improvements and under the TVS brand.  
- Ion Mobility was founded in 2019 and struggled to continue as an independent company despite previous funding.  
- The company had a presence in Singapore, Indonesia, Vietnam, and China with over 130 employees but was unable to secure additional financing.  
- Financial terms of the acquisition were not disclosed, previously reported to be 10 cents to a dollar for shareholders.

items.title: Lamudi’s parent appoints liquidator: Australian gov’t body
items.author: Not given
items.summary:
- Digital Classifieds Group (DCG), parent company of Lamudi, appoints a liquidator and administrator.
- This action indicates that DCG is in external administration, being insolvent or in financial difficulty.
- The appointed liquidator is Daniel Peter Juratowitch from advisory firm Cor Cordis.
- DCG acquired Lamudi’s businesses in Indonesia and the Philippines in October 2023.
- Previously, in July 2023, Lamudi laid off unspecified employees in Indonesia.

items.title: The women driving SEA’s top startups
items.summary:
- In honor of International Women’s Day, focus on female founders and leaders at SEA’s top companies.
- Lazada raised US$2.1 billion and has four women in leadership.
- Tyme Group leads with six women in top positions across Asia and South Africa.
- The latest list features 66 women, the highest since 2022.

items.title: Meet the 15 top-funded startups and tech companies in Vietnam
Sinar Mas digital arm starts building AI data center
items.summary:
- SM+, the digital infrastructure investment arm of Sinar Mas, begins construction on SMX01 data center for AI technologies.
- Located in Jakarta’s Central Business District, in collaboration with KIRA and LG Sinar Mas.
- Investment exceeds US$300 million, addressing Southeast Asia's digital infrastructure needs, projected market to reach US$1 trillion by 2030.
- Center expected to start operations in the second half of 2026, providing 15,500 sqm of data hall space for 2,400 server racks across nine data halls.
- Will support colocation, hyperscale solutions, and applications for AI and machine learning.

items.title: Reddit introduces new tools to boost compliance, posts
items.summary:
- Reddit launches new features to enhance user compliance with subreddit rules and improve post performance insights.
- New “rules check” tool is being tested on smartphones to help users adhere to subreddit-specific guidelines.
- A post recovery feature allows users to repost content to different subreddits if it is removed for rule violations.
- Reddit plans to provide tailored subreddit recommendations based on post content and clarify posting criteria for specific communities.

items.title: Grab exec departs to lead digital property firm
items.author: Not given
items.summary:
- Russell Cohen, Grab’s group managing director of operations, has announced his departure after nearly eight years with the company.
- He will return to Melbourne to become CEO of Pexa, a digital property settlement platform.
- Cohen joined Grab in 2017 during its transition from a ride-hailing app to a multi-vertical platform and credited the company’s growth to its culture and values.
- Expressed gratitude to Grab's leadership, team members, and CEO Anthony Tan for their support.
- Grab operates a super app offering ride-hailing, food delivery, and financial services in Southeast Asia.

items.title: Nintendo’s stock falls 8.4% as global investors retreat
items.summary:
[Nintendo's stock has dropped by 8.4% amid investor concerns.]
[Nintendo faces increased scrutiny and retreat from global investors.]
[The decline in stock may impact Nintendo’s market position and future strategies.]

items.title: Trump’s bitcoin reserve cuts $18b pressure, Coinbase exec says
items.author: Conor Grogan
items.summary:
- Conor Grogan from Coinbase estimates Trump's Strategic Bitcoin Reserve may relieve around $18 billion in sell-side pressure.
- Bitcoin’s price fell by 5% following the reserve's announcement, now trading at $85,798.
- The reserve will utilize bitcoins seized from criminal and civil asset forfeitures according to an executive order.
- David Sacks mentioned that the bitcoin will be kept as a store of value rather than being sold.
- Current holdings of the US government include approximately 198,109 bitcoin and 56,035 ethereum.

items.title: BYD launches in Kazakhstan
items.summary:
- BYD officially launched vehicles in Kazakhstan in partnership with Astana Motors.
- Launch events took place in Almaty and Astana, featuring the Han EV sedan and Song Plus models.
- The Han EV includes a blade battery, CTB body integration, 380 kW power, 0-100 km/h in 3.9 seconds, and a range of 565 km with 120 kW fast charging.
- The Song Plus EV has a range of 505–602 km and offers advanced driving assistance, while the plug-in hybrid Song Plus DM-i provides a 150 km electric range and 1,200 km total range.

items.title: Chinese milk tea chain Chagee secures approval for US IPO
items.summary:
- Chagee Holdings Limited has received approval for an overseas IPO from the China Securities Regulatory Commission.
- The company plans to issue approximately 64.7 million common shares and seek a listing on Nasdaq or the New York Stock Exchange within 12 months.
- Founded in 2017 in Kunming, Yunnan, Chagee grew from 1,000 stores in 2022 to 5,699 globally, with over 70% of stores opened in the past two years.

items.title: India gov’t launches AI compute portal, offers subsidies
items.author: Ashwini Vaishnaw
items.summary:
- Union IT minister Ashwini Vaishnaw announced initiatives under the 10,300 crore rupee (US$1.1 billion) IndiaAI mission on Mar. 6.
- The IndiaAI compute portal launched to enhance AI development in India.
- The portal will provide cost-effective AI computing resources, networking, storage, and cloud services to startups, researchers, students, and government agencies.
- Eligible users can access services at discounted rates, with a subsidy of up to 40%.
- The portal aims to help lower the costs of developing foundational models compared to other countries.

items.title: Nickel for your thoughts
items.author: Peter
items.summary:
- Nickel is essential for electric vehicle (EV) batteries, with Indonesia producing 61% of the world's refined nickel supply in 2024.
- The nickel mining boom poses environmental and geopolitical challenges, including sustainability issues and supply chain risks due to China's influence.
- Indonesia's role in the nickel market will significantly shape the development of the EV industry going forward.

items.title: 50 rising startups in Vietnam
items.summary:
- A list of startups in Vietnam that have recently raised funding, indicating their potential for growth.
- The focus is on companies up to the series E stage.
- Detailed information about each funding round is included in the list.

items.title: Mistral launches OCR tool for fast document processing
items.summary:
- Mistral has launched an Optical Character Recognition (OCR) tool named Mistral OCR.
- The tool processes images and PDFs, extracting various elements at speeds of up to 2,000 pages per minute.
- It supports multiple languages and can output structured JSON data, with a self-hosting option for data compliance.
- Pricing is set at US$1 for every 1,000 pages processed.

items.title: Chinese tech firm Monica unveils autonomous AI agent Manus
items.author: Xiao Hong
items.summary:
- Tech firm Monica.im launched Manus, an autonomous AI agent that performs complex tasks independently.
- Manus operates with a multisignature system powered by independent models.
- Monica.im plans to open-source parts of the technology later this year, including Manus’ inference capabilities for enhanced transparency.
- A demo showcased Manus' ability to screen candidates for a reinforcement learning engineer position by reviewing resumes and summarizing information like a human.

items.title: LG Uplus eyes $300m AI revenue in Google partnership
items.summary:
- LG Uplus aims to generate $300 million in AI revenue through its partnership with Google.
- The collaboration focuses on enhancing services and offerings in AI technology.
- The initiative underscores the growing trend of telecom companies investing in AI solutions.

items.title: US Labor Department Investigates Scale AI for Pay Compliance
items.summary:
- The US Department of Labor is investigating Scale AI for compliance with the Fair Labor Standards Act.
- The investigation focuses on issues such as unpaid wages, worker misclassification, and retaliation against employees.
- Active since at least August 2024, the probe does not imply any wrongdoing, and outcomes may be favorable to Scale AI or result in dismissal.
- Scale AI faces lawsuits from former employees regarding misclassification as contractors, which deprived them of overtime pay and sick leave benefits.
- Scale AI has been engaged in discussions with regulators to clarify its business practices.

items.title: ChatGPT reaches 400m weekly users in February
items.summary:
- ChatGPT achieved 400 million weekly active users by February 2025, doubling its user base in six months.
- Growth attributed to new models and features, notably GPT-4o's multimodal capabilities and advanced voice mode.
- Mobile usage grew to 175 million users, with monthly growth rates between 5% and 15% over the past year.
- ChatGPT set growth records since its launch in November 2022, reaching 100 million monthly users in just two months.

items.title: Broadcom forecasts $14.9b revenue on strong AI chip demand
items.summary:
- Broadcom expects to generate $14.9 billion in revenue driven by strong demand for AI chips.
- The forecast reflects the growing market for semiconductors related to artificial intelligence applications.
- This revenue forecast is part of the company's broader strategy to capitalize on advancements in AI technology.

items.title: Google co-founder reportedly formed new AI startup
items.summary:
- Larry Page, co-founder of Google, is developing a new AI startup named Dynatomics.
- The startup aims to enhance product manufacturing through AI.
- A small team of engineers is focused on creating AI-generated designs for efficient manufacturing.
- Chris Anderson, former CTO of Kittyhawk, is reportedly leading the project.

items.title: OpenAI, Oracle to build Texas AI data center with Nvidia chips
Indian digital payment firm Infibeam’s profit surges 50%
TSMC’s $100b US investment driven by customer demand, CEO says
items.author: C.C. Wei
items.summary:
- TSMC announced a US$100 billion investment in the US due to strong customer demand.
- Production lines at new US facilities are fully booked through 2027.
- TSMC continues to grow in Taiwan with 11 new production lines planned this year, compared to three in the US.
- The announcement highlights concerns over Taiwan's semiconductor industry dominance amid geopolitical tensions.

items.title: Privacy-focused search engine’s AI chatbot exits beta
items.author: Not given
items.summary:
- DuckDuckGo's AI chatbot and generated answers have exited beta testing.
- The AI feature, named DuckAssist, now gathers information from various online sources since its launch in 2023.
- AI-generated answers will appear for select queries about 20% of the time, with plans for gradual increases.
- Users can modify the frequency of these answers or disable the feature altogether.
- The chatbot, Duck.ai, will soon be integrated with web search to enhance its response capabilities.

items.title: Indian healthtech startup Truemeds to raise $44m series C
items.author: Akshat Nayyar, Kunal Wani
items.summary:
- Truemeds is raising approximately US$44 million in a series C funding round.
- The funding round is led by Accel India VII (Mauritius) Ltd, with contributions from other investors.
- The company aims to use the funds to expand operations and support growth efforts.
- Truemeds helps users find affordable alternatives to prescribed medications, focusing on generics.

items.title: Dubai’s top bank launches crypto trading for users
items.summary:
- Dubai's largest bank introduces cryptocurrency trading services for its users.
- This move aims to enhance digital banking solutions in the region.
- The launch is part of a broader trend of traditional banks adopting crypto services.

items.title: Dynatrace Acquires Israeli AI Startup Metis
items.summary:
- Dynatrace has acquired Israeli startup Metis, specializing in AI for database observability.
- Financial terms were not disclosed, but estimates suggest tens of millions of dollars.
- Metis, founded in 2021, focuses on AI technology to monitor cloud-native databases.
- Based in Tel Aviv, Metis has raised US$5 million in funding and has about 10 employees.
- This acquisition underscores Dynatrace's commitment to enhancing database observability in cloud-native technology development.

items.title: Singapore eyes $375m national semiconductor facility by 2027
items.author: Not given
items.summary:
- Singapore announced a new S$500 million (US$375 million) national fabrication facility for semiconductor companies by 2027.
- The facility will support R&D with cleanroom infrastructure and industry-grade tools, focusing on advanced packaging.
- The center will operate under the National Semiconductor Translation and Innovation Centre established by A*Star.
- Minister Gan Kim Yong emphasized nurturing Singapore enterprises to grow regionally or globally.
- The budget plan also includes significant investments in biomedical R&D and economic growth strategies.

items.title: SpaceX Starship loses control in second test failure
items.summary:
- SpaceX’s Starship faced a critical failure during a test flight on Mar.6.
- This incident marks the second consecutive unsuccessful launch for the spacecraft.
- The vehicle spiraled out of control after losing multiple engines eight minutes into its flight and broke apart over the Bahamas and the Dominican Republic.
- The FAA has mandated a mishap investigation in response to the incident.
- The FAA temporarily suspended flights into several major Florida airports as a precaution.
- Some flights were diverted due to concerns regarding potential space launch debris.

items.title: Zomato, Swiggy, Zepto face antitrust case over discounts
items.summary:
- Indian consumer products distributors have filed a complaint with the Competition Commission of India (CCI) against Zomato's Blinkit, Swiggy's Instamart, and Zepto.
- The complaint alleges anti-competitive practices, including predatory pricing and deep discounting that harm smaller retailers.
- The All India Consumer Products Distributors Federation (AICPDF) represents 400,000 distributors supplying products to 13 million retail shops across India.

items.title: EFishery lagged in tech integration: internal audit
items.summary:
- An internal review by FTI Consulting indicates eFishery is behind in technology adoption.
- Only 6,300 eFeeders deployed compared to a projected 400,000 units.
- Of US$314 million raised, only US$8.5 million (2.7%) was allocated for technology development.
- Former employees claim eFishery relies heavily on manual labor and lacks essential tech like water quality monitoring.
- The primary app lacks accounting system integration, leading to manual transaction handling.
- Efishery's business model connects fish farmers with suppliers and incurs significant losses according to reports.
- Recent events include severe layoffs and management changes amidst fraud allegations.

items.title: Defense tech startup Shield AI bags $240m, valued at $5.3b
items.summary:
- Shield AI raised US$240 million in a funding round, increasing its valuation to US$5.3 billion.
- The startup specializes in autonomous drones and software, notably its Hivemind platform for autonomous operations.
- The new funds will enhance software capabilities for businesses developing autonomous hardware in various domains.
- Investors include L3Harris Technologies, Hanwha Aerospace, Andreessen Horowitz, and Bloomberg Beta.
- Shield AI's V-BAT drone focuses on vertical takeoff and landing and operates in GPS-limited environments.
- The funding round was oversubscribed, indicating strong interest in defense tech startups and possible future funding from strategic investors.

items.title: A letter to my younger self: What’s the worst that could happen?
items.summary:
- The letter is part of Tech in Asia’s 2025 International Women’s Day campaign.
- The author reflects on their experiences as a student in the US, emphasizing exploration and growth.
- Key advice includes relying on curiosity to guide choices and asking, "What’s the worst that can happen?" to overcome hesitation.
- The author discusses the importance of hard work and taking opportunities, even if they seem unconventional.
- Emphasizes that decisions and experiences shape not just careers, but personal identity and understanding over time.

items.title: Indonesia lawmakers probe ride-hailing fee violations
items.summary:
- Indonesian lawmakers are investigating Gojek, Grab, and Maxim for charging commission fees up to 50%, exceeding the government-mandated cap of 20%.
- A public hearing on Mar. 5 highlighted ongoing complaints from drivers regarding high deductions.
- The Ministry of Transportation's Decree Number KP 667 of 2022 limits fees to 20%, yet drivers reported actual deductions ranging from 30% to 50%.
- Gojek, Grab, and Maxim did not respond to allegations during the hearing. 
- Previous claims by Maxim cited commissions between 5% and 15%, while Gojek and Grab stated adherence to the 20% cap, despite reports of programs leading to higher deductions.
- Drivers express dissatisfaction, leading to protests within Indonesia's ride-hailing sector.

items.title: TSMC chip testing partner eyes US expansion
items.summary:
- TSMC's testing partner is planning to expand operations in the US.
- The move is expected to enhance the company's capabilities and meet growing demand in the semiconductor sector.
- This expansion aligns with the increasing trend of semiconductor manufacturing shifting closer to key markets in the US.

items.title: US-based edutech Chegg sues Google over AI content use
items.summary:
- Chegg has filed a lawsuit against Google, alleging monopolistic behavior and content exploitation through AI features.
- The lawsuit claims that Google's “AI Overviews” are diverting web traffic from Chegg, negatively impacting its business.
- Chegg attributes over a 90% market cap decline to these AI changes, raising questions about fair use versus infringement.
- The case could set important legal precedents regarding AI's role in search engines transitioning to AI-driven “answer engines.”
- Legal experts indicate that businesses need to evaluate potential AI-related risks, including intellectual property issues.
- Google has not yet released a statement on the lawsuit, which may influence future AI regulations and business practices.

items.title: China launches $138b fund to boost chips, AI, quantum tech
items.summary:
- China plans to establish a fund of 1 trillion yuan (US$138 billion) for tech startups.
- Announced by Zheng Shanjie of the National Development and Reform Commission.
- Focus areas include semiconductors, renewable energy, AI, and quantum technology.
- Fund aims for long-term investments with higher risk tolerance for seed-stage companies.
- Initiative supports China's strategy for enhancing AI applications and technological self-reliance.

items.title: JD.com reports $1.4b profit as Chinese consumer spending rises
items.summary:
- JD.com reported a fourth-quarter profit of approximately US$1.4 billion, up from US$469.5 million last year.
- Revenue for the December quarter rose to US$47.9 billion, a 13.4% increase from 306 billion yuan.
- Following the report, JD.com’s US-listed shares rose nearly 5% in pre-market trading, and its Hong Kong shares closed 8.42% higher at US$23.03 on Mar. 6.

items.title: Y Combinator Leads $1.1M Funding Round for Indian Fintech
items.summary:
- Bengaluru-based startup Yenmo raised 9.2 crore rupee (US$1.06 million) in funding led by Y Combinator.
- The funds will expand product offerings and enhance the technology platform.
- Yenmo plans to introduce new secured lending options and develop a competitive savings account feature.
- The startup focuses on improving its digital platform for faster loan applications and scaling operations.
- Interest rates for loans against mutual funds start at 10.5%, lower than standard personal loan rates.
- Yenmo's platform is accessible through mobile apps for Android and iOS.

items.title: Chinese robotics firm Unitree opens new subsidiary
items.summary:
- Unitree has launched a new subsidiary, Shenzhen Tianyi Technology, focused on intelligent and service robots.
- The company has previously set up similar subsidiaries in Beijing and Shanghai in late 2024.
- Shenzhen aims to develop a 100 billion yuan humanoid robotics sector by 2027, establishing a cluster of 1,200 robotics firms.

items.title: Tesla’s sales drop 51% in China
items.summary:
- Tesla's sales in mainland China fell to 30,688 vehicles in February 2025.
- This represents a 51.5% drop from January and a 49.2% decline year-over-year.
- This is Tesla's lowest sales in China since July 2022, with 28,217 vehicles delivered then.
- The overall EV market in China saw a 3% decline in deliveries in February, with 720,000 units sold.

items.title: Taco Bell Expands AI Technology in Drive-Throughs
items.summary:
- Taco Bell showcased its AI advancements at a Yum Brands investor event on Mar. 5 in Brooklyn, New York.
- AI voice technology for drive-through orders has expanded from 100 to 500 US locations.
- Introduced the “Byte by Yum” AI suite for restaurant managers, addressing labor scheduling and inventory management.
- Demo video featured Byte AI Restaurant Coach for labor and inventory optimization.
- Approximately 25,000 out of 61,000 global Yum restaurants are now using tools from the Byte suite.
- Competitors are also adopting AI-driven solutions for drive-throughs and digital programs.
- Yum Brands projects an 8% rise in same-store sales for Taco Bell and considers expanding AI software beyond its brands.

items.title: Revenue AI platform MaxIQ raises $7.8m seed funding
items.author: Sonny Aulakh
items.summary:
- MaxIQ, formerly Gyaan AI, raised $7.8 million in seed funding.
- The investment was led by Dell Technologies Capital, with participation from Intel Capital.
- Funding will be used to scale operations, enhance products, and expand the leadership team.
- Founded in 2022, the company improves customer journey management for B2B SaaS.
- New leadership includes CEO Matt Hickey and Chief Revenue Officer Rob Sexton, both with experience from Palo Alto Networks and EMC.

items.title: Weekly funding: Indian startups take three top posts
items.author: Queena Wadyanti, Charmaine de Lazo
items.summary:
- Weekly compilation of startup funding activities in Asia.
- Top 10 funding deals of the week highlighted, details require subscription.
- Access to all funding rounds and investor lists available via Tech in Asia.

items.title: ASML to open repair hub in China despite US export curbs
items.summary:
- ASML Holding plans to open a “reuse and repair” center in Beijing in 2025.
- This decision is influenced by US export restrictions on advanced chip technology for China.
- The project aligns with ASML’s commitment to a circular economy through the reuse of parts and tools.
- ASML is currently prohibited from selling its advanced EUV lithography systems to Chinese clients.

items.title: Cybersecurity firm Armis buys Israel’s Otorio for $120m
items.summary:
- Cybersecurity firm Armis has acquired Israel's Otorio for $120 million.
- The acquisition aims to enhance Armis' capabilities in cybersecurity solutions.
- Otorio specializes in operational technology security, complementing Armis' portfolio.

items.title: Indian food delivery startup Swish nets $14m series A
items.summary:
- Indian food delivery startup Swish has raised $14 million in a Series A funding round.
- The funding round was led by prominent investors aimed at expanding Swish's services.
- This investment highlights the growing demand for food delivery services in the Indian market.

items.title: China’s iFlyTek plans Europe expansion as US tensions rise
items.summary:
- China’s iFlyTek is planning to expand operations in Europe amid rising tensions with the US.
- The expansion aims to tap into the European market for artificial intelligence technology.
- iFlyTek focuses on speech recognition and natural language processing solutions.
- The company is responding to declining sales in the US due to regulatory pressures.
- This move reflects a broader trend of Chinese technology firms seeking opportunities outside the US.

items.title: Indonesian startups’ struggles pose dilemma for Danantara
items.summary:
- Danantara, Indonesia's sovereign wealth fund (SWF), has an initial capital of US$20 billion and is compared to Singapore’s Temasek.
- Its investment focus is currently on sectors like natural resource processing and AI development, not explicitly on startups.
- AC Ventures co-founder Pandu Sjahrir has been appointed as Danantara's chief investment officer, signaling potential changes in investment strategy.
- The Indonesian startup ecosystem faces challenges, particularly with late-stage startups struggling to attract funding amid recent fraud scandals.
- Experts suggest that a single bad investment could jeopardize Danantara’s credibility with global investors.
- Unlike Temasek, Danantara is unlikely to prioritize startup investments immediately but may consider them in the future.
